results.title: Triple trouble
results.creator_credit: Leo White, Charles Chaplin and Essanay Film Manufacturing Company
results.brief_description: A slapstick comedy starring Charlie Chaplin as a screwball kitchenhand who unwittingly foils Colonel W. Nutt’s scientific research and in the process involves everyone around him in a search for local train robbers. Also stars: Billy Armstrong, Albert Austin, Henry Bergman, Bud Jamison, James J. Kelley, ‘Snub’ Pollard, Edna Purviance, Wesley Ruggles and Leo White.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Leo White, Charles Chaplin and Essanay Film Manufacturing Company

results.title: Dark wind
results.creator_credit: Errol Morris, Patrick Markey and Northfork Motion Pictures
results.brief_description: Dark Wind is a tangled web of deceit between two law enforcements. Lou Diamond Phillips plays Jim Chee a young police officer working on a reserve in Arizona belonging to the Navajo’s. He finds himself in constant dispute with the local sheriff of the Hopi clan who want to share the reserve with the Navajo’s. Into the web is a robbery, a plane crash and a decaying body that has been in the desert for some time and the mysterious call in the wind of death. Nothing is as it seems in this electric thriller set amongst ritual and superstition of the people of Arizona. Cast also includes Fred Ward, Gary Farmer, John Karlen.

results.title: Brass
results.creator_credit: Sidney A. Franklin, Harry Rapf and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Philip Baldwin (Monte Blue) is the son of a prosperous fruit-farmer. His marriage to Rosemary, daughter of his father’s best friend has been planned since they were children, but when gold-digging city girl Marjorie (Marie Prevost) finds work during the summer vacation at the ranch, she seduces Philip into marriage. Domestic problems, city living and friction with his mother-in-law contribute to Marjorie divorcing Philip and abandoning their son. Philip then discovers true love with Mrs Grotenberg (Irene Rich) the widow who boards with the family and cares for the child. Cast also includes Harry Meyers, Frank Keenan and Harvey Clark. Based on the novel by Charles G. Norris.

results.title: Virgin machine = Die Jungfrauen Maschine
results.creator_credit: Monika Treut, 11 Film and Hyena Films
results.brief_description: Initially intending to write a story, Dorothy, a young journalist researching romantic love, travels to the United States following the footsteps of her mother who immigrated there many years before. In San Francisco she is introduced to the lesbian scene by a number of women including Susie Sexpert who initiates her into the practical arsenal of the American pragmatics of love, Dominique, a Hungarian bohemian from Uruguay and Ramona, a lesbian sex therapist with whom she falls in love. Treut employs experimental techniques to facilitate a first person insight into Dorothy’s journey of sexual discovery. The direction and camera style also reflect the film’s two locales; Germany, where Dorothy experiences paranoia, and California, the wonderland where she reacts with amazement at the subcultures she discovers. Cast includes Ina Blum, Shelly Mars, Peter Kern and Susie Bright.

results.title: Cunnamulla
results.creator_credit: Dennis O'Rourke, ABC-TV (Australia), Camerawork and Film Australia
results.brief_description: The small outback town of Cunnamulla is situated in rural Queensland, 800 kilometres west of Brisbane. As one of the characters in this documentary says, “Cunnamulla is a town at the end of the railroad”, a once prosperous sheep farming territory that now has high levels of unemployment and petty crime. O’Rourke allows the people of the town to speak for themselves. The picture they paint is bleak; a town divided along racial and age lines, where whites and Aborigines are mutually suspicious of each other, where parents and grandparents can no longer understand the choices their children are making when it comes to sex, drugs and work. Filmed over the approaching Christmas period, “Cunnamulla” has its fair share of eccentric and stoic human beings, but the overriding impression is that the rapid pace of globalisation is exacerbating conflict and leading to the death of the very town itself. Whether it is in the doleful expression of a young man about to enter prison, or in the exasperated eyes of a father talking about his heavy metal obsessed son, O’Rourke’s film creates a vivid, powerful and disturbing portrait of outback Australia.

results.title: Asterix conquers America
results.creator_credit: Gerhard Hahn, Jurgen Wohlrabe and Extrafilm Production
results.brief_description: When a brawl breaks out between the Gauls and the Romans, the potion that gives Asterix and Obelix their powers tips over. Before more can be made, the Romans kidnap Getafix and hurl him into space, believing of course that the world is flat. When Asterix and Obelix go after him, they land in America, encountering strange animals and meeting a group of Indians. Based on the popular books by Goscinny and Underzo.

results.title: The Fox and the hound
results.creator_credit: Richard Rich, Ted Berman, Art Stevens, Wolfgang Reitherman and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: This classic Disney tale is a heartwarming story of two best friends who didn’t know they were supposed to be enemies. Orphaned fox cub Tod is adopted by a lonely widow, and the fun and adventure begins when he meets Copper, an adorable hound puppy. Under the watchful eyes of Big Mama Owl, the innocent pair play and frolic in the forest, becoming inseparable friends - each unaware that the future will see them pitted against each other as each must fulfill his role in the scheme of things. Reflecting such timeless values as love, courage and the importance of friendship, and featuring the vocal talents of Mickey Rooney, Kurt Russell, Sandy Duncan, Pearl Bailey and Corey Feldman, this is a very endearing movie for the young and the young at heart.

results.title: Asterix and the big fight
results.creator_credit: Philippe Grimond, Nicolas Pesques, Gaumont and ExtraFilm Produktion
results.brief_description: In this, the sixth animated Asterix feature, Asterix, Obelix and their faithful canine Dogmatix are left alone to defend their village against the Romans after the rest of the villagers have fled from a terrible thunderstorm. Unfortunately for them the druid Getafix has lost his memory after being accidently knocked unconscious with a menhir by Obelix and is unable to remember the formula for the potion that gives Asterix the superhuman strength he relies on to defeat the Romans. Based on the popular books by Goscinny and Underzo.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Philippe Grimond, Nicolas Pesques, Gaumont and ExtraFilm Produktion

results.title: Shadow of the vampire [DVD]
results.creator_credit: E. Elias Merhige, Jeff Levine, Nicolas Cage, Saturn Films and Niche Pictures
results.brief_description: Shadow of the vampire is an adventurous and atmospheric docu-drama that offers a fascinating hypothesis as to how gifted German director F.W.Murnau may have managed to achieve his goal of making his 1922 film - “Nosferatu” - one of the most eerie and authentic vampire films ever. After being refused the right to film Stoker’s “Dracula”, Murnau (John Malkovich) begins filming interior shots for his unauthorized version in Berlin. Refusing to impart detailed information about the direction of the film, and the mysterious Max Schreck (Willem Dafoe), who is to play “Count Orlock”, he moves the cast and crew out to a remote location in Czechoslovakia for the shooting of pivotal scenes involving the vampire. Displaced by their surroundings, and frustrated by Murnau’s ambiguity, everyone is taken aback when the elusive Shreck - who is only to be filmed at night, and only in full make-up - finally makes his first appearance. Shreck’s bizarre behaviour and Murnau’s unwavering determination to continue filming at all costs begin to take their strain on the production, and soon details of Murnau’s alleged Faustian pact to secure the vampire’s services emerge. As well as being director, E. Elias Merhige’s homage to one of the great directors, this film also functions as a dark but witty exploration of the sacrifices one is willing to make, of oneself and others, in the pursuit of artistic perfection.
results.creator_credit_for_label: E. Elias Merhige, Jeff Levine, Nicolas Cage, Saturn Films and Niche Pictures

results.title: Last resort [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Pawel Pawlikowski, Ruth Caleb and BBC Film Unit
results.brief_description: The low key Last Resort is an offbeat love story set around a defunct British seaside holiday resort. Russian immigrant Tanya (Dina Korzun) arrives at Gatwick airport with her ten year old son Artiom (Artiom Strelinikov) to be reunited with her British fiance. When he doesn’t arrive the distressed Tanya rashly decides to claim political asylum in order to stay in the country. She is then taken to a refuge holding center situated in an abandoned holiday resort where she virtually becomes a prisoner. While detained she meets amusement arcade manager Alfie (Paddy Considine) an ex-crim who takes Tanya and her son under his wings. Soon enough an unlikely romance develops between the pair. Director Pawel Pawlikowski handles his material delicately eliciting some wonderful naturalistic performances from his leads. While cinematographer Ryszard Lenczewski adds to the melancholy nature of the film by giving the look of the once thriving fun park an eerie beauty. Cast includes Lindsey Honey, Dave Bean, Katie Drinkwater. Pawel Pawlikowski: Winner of the 2001 BAFTA award for the Most Promising Newcomer in British Film.
